meanings.definition: Test or experiment with (a new idea or method)
meanings.sent1: She trialed the new recipe to see if it tasted good.
meanings.sent2: The scientists trialed the new drug to determine its effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: He trialed a crazy idea to wear socks on his hands.
meanings.sent4: The team trialed a bold strategy that paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The students trialed different study methods to find the most effective one.

meanings.definition: Subject (someone or something) to a trial
meanings.sent1: The judge trialed the suspect to determine their guilt.
meanings.sent2: They trialed the new employee to assess their skills.
meanings.sent3: The teacher trialed the mischievous student with extra homework.
meanings.sent4: The coach trialed the athlete in various positions to find the best fit.
meanings.sent5: The chef trialed the apprentice by having them prepare a complex dish.
